column4: how do I check what package installed a file with deb package system?
uninstall whatver you wanna remove from there
you can use unetbootin or usb-cretor-gtk   not sure about Win7 ISO though. I'd ask in ##windows about that
does it have a floppy drive?
and do you have a floppy disk?
http://www.pendrivelinux.com/use-a-floppy-to-boot-usb-pendrive-linux/    you could use that if you had a floppy
sounds like you grabbed a 64bit ISO
whole bunch of gold dust here then: http://www.ebay.com/itm/NIB-OFFICE-DEPOT-2HD-IBM-3-1-2-DISKETTES-FORMATTED-1-44-MB-125-Discs-/221153599688?pt=US_Floppy_Zip_Jaz_Disks&hash=item337dc820c8
sounds like the USB is booting, just that there are features in puppy which maybe the CPU doesn't have. I'd ask in the puppy channel
